item.title: Caution: Superman is poisonous
item.description: According to a McAfee blog post, Superman poses a significant online threat. The company argues that the widespread presence of superheroes beyond comic books allows hackers and scammers to exploit them for cybercrime. McAfee’s survey, which used their SiteAdvisor site ratings, revealed that Superman is the “Most Toxic Superhero.” The study found that searches combining “Superman” with terms like “free torrent download,” “watch,” “free app,” and “online” have a 16.5% chance of leading to websites containing threats like spyware, adware, spam, phishing, viruses, and other malware.

item.title: Singapore ranked among the top five in the 2016 WE Cities Index
item.description: Dell has identified the top 25 cities worldwide that cultivate high-potential women entrepreneurs (HPWE) for 2016 through their Women Entrepreneur Cities Index (WE Cities). This unique index assesses a city’s capacity to attract and promote the growth of women-led businesses. The study focused on cities rather than countries to highlight how local policies and initiatives impact women entrepreneurs, in addition to national legislation and norms. The WE Cities findings will serve as a starting point for discussions at the seventh annual Dell Womenâ€™s Entrepreneur Network Summit (DWEN).

item.title: The Top 25 Multinational Workplaces consist of widely recognized brands
item.description: Great Place to Work, a global firm that assists organizations in developing positive workplace cultures, has announced its yearly ranking of the top 25 multinational workplaces worldwide. This list is derived from an extensive study of workplace environments and recognizes companies with exceptional work cultures. To be eligible for this list, companies must meet specific requirements: placement on at least five national “Best Workplaces” lists, a minimum of 5,000 employees, and a workforce comprised of at least 40% employees based outside of the company’s home country.

item.title: The Minute List focuses on dining experiences created by talented chefs and baristas
item.description: Hurrah! Productions, a TV and digital content agency based in Asia, has introduced The Minute List, a first-of-its-kind video-driven guide for bars and restaurants in Singapore. This online platform features one-minute videos showcasing popular restaurants, bars, and cafes in the city. It allows users to make direct reservations at these establishments. Featured venues are nominated by industry professionals, such as chefs, bartenders, and baristas. Each nominated venue is presented through a video interview with the head chef, bartender, or barista.
